page.title: 05RELIGION, BLEASDALE
page.content:
It is known that a chapel existed at Admarsh in the time of Elizabeth I. Regular services were unknown until 1702 when a Chistopher Parkinson gave Â£8 10 shillings a year for a minister to preach once a month.
In 1835 the church was named St.Eadmers.This is the only church in the country dedicated to this Saint.
In 1897 the church was enlarged.
The present Priest-in-Charge is the Rev.A.H.Bennett who is also Vicar of St.James's,Whitechapel.
Matins and Holy Communion are held on alternate Sunday mornings at 11.45am.
